header.name: boost/algorithm/algorithm.hpp

description.para: The value to be exponentiated
The exponent (must be >= 0)

returns.para: the value "x" raised to the power "n"

description.para: The value to be exponentiated
The exponent (must be >= 0)
The operation used

returns.para: the value "x" raised to the power "n" using the operation "op".

header.name: boost/algorithm/apply_permutation.hpp

header.name: boost/algorithm/clamp.hpp
header.para: Clamp algorithm.

Marshall Clow
Suggested by olafvdspek in https://svn.boost.org/trac/boost/ticket/3215

description.para: The value to be clamped
The lower bound of the range to be clamped to
The upper bound of the range to be clamped to
A predicate to use to compare the values. p ( a, b ) returns a boolean.

returns.para: the value "val" brought into the range [ lo, hi ] using the comparison predicate p. If p ( val, lo ) return lo. If p ( hi, val ) return hi. Otherwise, return the original value.

function.name: clamp_range
function.type: BOOST_CXX14_CONSTEXPR boost::disable_if_c< boost::is_same< Range, OutputIterator >::value, OutputIterator >::type

description.para: The range of values to be clamped
An output iterator to write the clamped values into

parameter.name: lo
parameter.paramtype: typename std::iterator_traits< typename boost::range_iterator< const Range >::type >::value_type const &

description.para: The lower bound of the range to be clamped to

parameter.name: hi
parameter.paramtype: typename std::iterator_traits< typename boost::range_iterator< const Range >::type >::value_type const &

description.para: The upper bound of the range to be clamped to

returns.para: clamp the sequence of values [first, last) into [ lo, hi ]

function.name: clamp_range
function.type: BOOST_CXX14_CONSTEXPR boost::disable_if_c< boost::is_same< Range, OutputIterator >::value, OutputIterator >::type

description.para: The range of values to be clamped
An output iterator to write the clamped values into

parameter.name: lo
parameter.paramtype: typename std::iterator_traits< typename boost::range_iterator< const Range >::type >::value_type const &

description.para: The lower bound of the range to be clamped to

parameter.name: hi
parameter.paramtype: typename std::iterator_traits< typename boost::range_iterator< const Range >::type >::value_type const &

description.para: The upper bound of the range to be clamped to
A predicate to use to compare the values. p ( a, b ) returns a boolean.

returns.para: clamp the sequence of values [first, last) into [ lo, hi ] using the comparison predicate p.

header.name: boost/algorithm/cxx11/all_of.hpp

A predicate for testing the elements of the range

note.para: returns true on an empty range

returns.para: true if all elements in the range satisfy the predicate 'p'

A value to compare against

note.para: returns true on an empty range

returns.para: true if all elements in the range are equal to 'val'

header.name: boost/algorithm/cxx11/copy_if.hpp

description.para: The start of the input sequence
One past the end of the input sequence
An output iterator to write the results into
A predicate for testing the elements of the range

function.purpose: Copies all the elements from the input range that satisfy the predicate to the output range.

note.para: This function is part of the C++2011 standard library.

returns.para: The updated output iterator

description.para: The input range
An output iterator to write the results into
A predicate for testing the elements of the range

function.purpose: Copies all the elements from the input range that satisfy the predicate to the output range.

returns.para: The updated output iterator

A predicate for testing the elements of the range

header.name: boost/algorithm/cxx11/copy_n.hpp
header.para: Copy n items from one sequence to another.

description.para: The start of the input sequence
The number of elements to copy
An output iterator to write the results into

function.purpose: Copies exactly n (n > 0) elements from the range starting at first to the range starting at result.

note.para: This function is part of the C++2011 standard library.

returns.para: The updated output iterator

header.name: boost/algorithm/cxx11/is_partitioned.hpp
header.para: Tell if a sequence is partitioned.

function.name: is_partitioned

description.para: The start of the input sequence
One past the end of the input sequence
The predicate to test the values with

function.purpose: Tests to see if a sequence is partitioned according to a predicate. In other words, all the items in the sequence that satisfy the predicate are at the beginning of the sequence.

note.para: This function is part of the C++2011 standard library.

function.name: is_partitioned

description.para: The input range
The predicate to test the values with

function.purpose: Tests to see if a sequence is partitioned according to a predicate. In other words, all the items in the sequence that satisfy the predicate are at the beginning of the sequence.

Range based versions of the C++11 functions

description.para: The start of the sequence to be tested.
One past the end of the sequence
Range based versions of the C++11 functions

note.para: This function will return true for sequences that contain items that compare equal. If that is not what you intended, you should use is_strictly_increasing instead.

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is increasing; i.e, each item is greater than or equal to the previous one.

description.para: The range to be tested.

note.para: This function will return true for sequences that contain items that compare equal. If that is not what you intended, you should use is_strictly_increasing instead.

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is increasing; i.e, each item is greater than or equal to the previous one.

description.para: The start of the sequence to be tested.
One past the end of the sequence

note.para: This function will return true for sequences that contain items that compare equal. If that is not what you intended, you should use is_strictly_decreasing instead.

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is decreasing; i.e, each item is less than or equal to the previous one.

description.para: The range to be tested.

note.para: This function will return true for sequences that contain items that compare equal. If that is not what you intended, you should use is_strictly_decreasing instead.

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is decreasing; i.e, each item is less than or equal to the previous one.

description.para: The start of the sequence to be tested.
One past the end of the sequence

note.para: This function will return false for sequences that contain items that compare equal. If that is not what you intended, you should use is_increasing instead.

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is strictly increasing; i.e, each item is greater than the previous one

description.para: The range to be tested.

note.para: This function will return false for sequences that contain items that compare equal. If that is not what you intended, you should use is_increasing instead.

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is strictly increasing; i.e, each item is greater than the previous one

description.para: The start of the sequence to be tested.
One past the end of the sequence

note.para: This function will return false for sequences that contain items that compare equal. If that is not what you intended, you should use is_decreasing instead.

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is strictly decreasing; i.e, each item is less than the previous one

description.para: The range to be tested.

note.para: This function will return false for sequences that contain items that compare equal. If that is not what you intended, you should use is_decreasing instead.

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is strictly decreasing; i.e, each item is less than the previous one

function.purpose: Copies the elements that satisfy the predicate p from the range [first, last) to the range beginning at d_first_true, and copies the elements that do not satisfy p to the range beginning at d_first_false.

An output iterator to write the elements that satisfy the predicate into

The predicate to test the values with

header.name: boost/algorithm/cxx17/reduce.hpp
header.para: Combine the elements of a sequence into a single value.

function.name: transform_inclusive_scan

description.para: The start of the input sequence
The start of the input sequence
The end of the input sequence
The end of the input sequence
The output iterator to write the results into
The output iterator to write the results into
The operation for combining transformed input elements
The operation for combining transformed input elements
The operation for transforming input elements
The operation for transforming input elements
The initial value

function.purpose: Transforms elements from the input range with uOp and then combines those transformed elements with bOp such that the n-1th element and the nth element are combined. Inclusivity means that the nth element is included in the nth combination.

description.para: Transforms elements from the input range with uOp and then combines those transformed elements with bOp such that the n-1th element and the nth element are combined. Inclusivity means that the nth element is included in the nth combination. The first value will be used as the init.

note.para: This function is part of the C++17 standard library
This function is part of the C++17 standard library

returns.para: The updated output iterator
The updated output iterator

header.name: boost/algorithm/hex.hpp
header.para: Convert sequence of integral types into a sequence of hexadecimal characters and back. Based on the MySQL functions HEX and UNHEX.

struct.name: hex_decode_error
struct.purpose: Base exception class for all hex decoding errors.

struct.name: non_hex_input
struct.purpose: Thrown when a non-hex value (0-9, A-F) encountered when decoding. Contains the offending character.

struct.name: not_enough_input
struct.purpose: Thrown when the input sequence unexpectedly ends.

function.name: hex

description.para: The start of the input sequence
One past the end of the input sequence
An output iterator to the results into

function.purpose: Converts a sequence of integral types into a hexadecimal sequence of characters.

note.para: Based on the MySQL function of the same name

returns.para: The updated output iterator

header.name: boost/algorithm/is_clamped.hpp
header.para: IsClamped algorithm.

description.para: The value to be checked
The lower bound of the range
The upper bound of the range
A predicate to use to compare the values. p ( a, b ) returns a boolean.

returns.para: true if value "val" is in the range [ lo, hi ] using the comparison predicate p. If p ( val, lo ) return false. If p ( hi, val ) return false. Otherwise, returns true.

description.para: The value to be checked
The lower bound of the range
The upper bound of the range

returns.para: true if value "val" is in the range [ lo, hi ] using operator < for comparison. If the value is less than lo, return false. If the value is greater than hi, return false. Otherwise, returns true.

header.name: boost/algorithm/is_palindrome.hpp
header.para: Checks the input sequence on palindrome.

description.para: The start of the input sequence
One past the end of the input sequence
A predicate used to compare the values.

note.para: This function will return true for empty sequences and for palindromes. For other sequences function will return false. Complexity: O(N).

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is palindrome

description.para: The start of the input sequence
One past the end of the input sequence

note.para: This function will return true for empty sequences and for palindromes. For other sequences function will return false. Complexity: O(N).

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is palindrome

description.para: The range to be tested.

note.para: This function will return true for empty sequences and for palindromes. For other sequences function will return false. Complexity: O(N).

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is palindrome

description.para: The range to be tested.
A predicate used to compare the values.

note.para: This function will return true for empty sequences and for palindromes. For other sequences function will return false. Complexity: O(N).

returns.para: true if the entire sequence is palindrome

header.name: boost/algorithm/is_partitioned_until.hpp
header.para: Tell if a sequence is partitioned.

function.name: is_partitioned_until

description.para: The start of the input sequence
One past the end of the input sequence
The predicate to test the values with

function.purpose: Tests to see if a sequence is partitioned according to a predicate. In other words, all the items in the sequence that satisfy the predicate are at the beginning of the sequence.

note.para: Returns the first iterator 'it' in the sequence [first, last) for which is_partitioned(first, it, p) is false. Returns last if the entire sequence is partitioned. Complexity: O(N).

function.name: is_partitioned_until

description.para: The input range
The predicate to test the values with

function.purpose: Tests to see if a sequence is partitioned according to a predicate. In other words, all the items in the sequence that satisfy the predicate are at the beginning of the sequence.

note.para: Returns the first iterator 'it' in the sequence [first, last) for which is_partitioned(first, it, p) is false. Returns last if the entire sequence is partitioned. Complexity: O(N).
